data.title: Landmark
data.text: The Vance Monument is located in Pack Square and serves as a good landmark to meet up with people. Knowing about Zebulon Vance, it seems that others are more deserving of a monument but history has the good and bad aspects. So in a way it seems fitting that the square is used for parades and protests that promote diversity and equality.

data.title: Ok Monument
data.text: The Vance Monument is fine; it is located in a great area of Asheville and looks fine. Until reading the reviews I was unaware of the controversy arising from Vance having owned slaves. Perhaps the best response would be for diverse groups to use the Monument as a meeting place, likely causing the old bigot to spin in his grave.

data.title: Vance Monument
data.text: They Vance monument basically is downtown Asheville amongst restaurants ,clubs ,shops ,and other items of interest. This monument does have some background that may be disturbing to some individuals but it is part of history.

data.title: Lovely piece of NC history
data.text: we took an uber to downtown. lots of restaurants and a fun vibe. this was on our stroll. The weather was PERFECT for an evening stroll and this monument was our last stop. Don't make a trip just for this but if your trip includes downtown or the arts district check it out. Why do people rate parts of our history as "terrible"??? It's HISTORICAL. it's not supposed to be flashy or entertaining. It is a memorial meant to honor an important part of history. there are a fair amount of beggars and homeless hippie types making it more colorful. Reminds me of Boulder CO.

data.title: Cool monument
data.text: This monument is easy to spot because it is very similar to the Washington monument in DC. It's right downtown next to some government buildings and restaurants.

data.title: This is a nice sw
data.text: This is a great central location to meet with friends (you can't miss it) but I struggle with the fact that Vance was a slave owner.  There has been outspoken controversy about tearing it down.  It's not attractive even attractive.  There are so many others more worthy of a monument in Asheville.

data.title: While it's still named after Vance
data.text: The monument might be a good landmark, as in "meet me there in an hour," because it's pretty central to downtown. The adjacent public art is more beautiful and interesting than the Vance Monument. However, as an historical place marker, it might have value, especially in these days. Vance was a slave owner, and occasionally an "artist" protests t with a can of spray paint on the Vance Monument. Get your selfie while it's still named after Zeb Vance.

data.title: The space is great.  The fact that it is a monument to a slave owner is problematic.
data.text: The Vance monument immortalizes a man who was both a civil war governor of the state and a slave owner.  There is a great deal of controversy around having this as the center of a liberal community.  It is also where most political protests take place.  A very controversial spot!

data.title: It's a tall monument, right in the middle of downtown
data.text:
Nothing special to see here.  It's in the middle of the square, with a nice number of restaurants around it, but the monument is nothing special.  

Reading the plaque you learn a little more of its history, but certainly not worth a special trip.

data.title: People watching
data.text: Located right in the middle of downtown you can always watch all the people walking around. They have a few craft fairs set up here from time to time and the area is abundant in restaurants and shops.

data.title: Bigger than it Looks
data.text: Walking along Biltmore Ave, the randomly placed obelisk quickly draws one's attention.  It just looks so out of place and, frankly, is kind of ugly.  I normally would have ignored it and kept walking except that there was a group of protesters there so I decided to go have a look.  It was a surprisingly large.  The area behind the monument holds a large field and two picturesque buildings.  I'm told that people frequently hold rallies by the monument and the venue holds all sorts of community events in the summer.  The Vance Monument is well worth a visit, you never know what you may find.

data.title: See one, you've seen them all!
data.text: It is OK, nothing spectacular. A part of local history though. Not worth a dpecial trip, but once you are in the area, what the he k!

data.title: nice park
data.text: vance monument is near pack park/square. very nice structure considering asheville isn't rome or egypt.

data.title: Always admire my great great grandfather's monument.
data.text: My great great grandfather james g colvin built this obelisk many years ago. If you take the hop on hop off bus they will bring up some architect as the person who built it but that is not the case. These obelisks are all over scotland and that is where my family came from. If you are on vacation in asheville it's in the middle of downtown and easy to see.

data.title: Arts and Craft show.
data.text:
Many, many exhibits of local artisans' crafts. Found some great gifts for
others and myself. Had a great Sat morning, strolling around area. It's an ideal location for the Arts Market, nice to be in downtown Asheville.

data.title: Stone
data.text: Its an obelisk in the center of Asheville dedicated to a CIvil War-era leader - not much more to say - sorry

data.title: Neat history in town
data.text: Neat history in town. Just a monument but great to know the history behind it and the fact its in asheville. Besutiful area

data.title: You Can't Miss It
data.text: if you go to the visitor center in the downtown area, you will see this monument.  It is a nice memorial, but I wouldn't go out of my way to see it.

data.title: Unusual
data.text: this obelisk  is In honor of Zebulon vance who was the lawyer to Tom dula who weirdly inspired the song Tom Dooley. He was also the author of the scattered nation which has something to do with religious tolerance.I visited this looking at I kind of was like why?? I looked up the obelisk and found out it honors this gentleman and his accomplishments.

data.title: Nothing too special!
data.text: Nothing too special about it - just a usual pillar. Only thing about it is that it is located at the heart of the center so you will most probably see it anyway.
